page.title: 04ROAD SCHEME.
page.content: In the 1930's the outer ring road was proposed to skirt the city of Leicester.The urban area has grown and the Southern District Distributor road now under construction aims to improve access to industrial development and major motorways in Leicestershire. The first sign of the road development was the felling of some twenty mature lime trees on the A50 which were about forty years old.Local people were very apprehensive about the development scheme.Individual protests grew into group action. They used local radio and papers,lobbied councillors and expressed local opinion.In the end they managed to change the plan from a dual carriageway to a single one. Landscaping will compensate for the disturbance to the environment.
